Sections.Name: Domains
Sections.Description: The domains listed here are some areas that may cause you to feel anxious. Please select the one from which you'd like to see resources.

PageGroups.Name: Classes, Tutoring, and Accomodations
PageGroups.Title: Academics/Work/Career Development: Classes, Tutoring, and Accomodations

Parameters.Text:
Lou's List 

Deciding what classes to enroll in next semester? Made for UVA students, Lou's List gives you an extensive list of class options. 

https://louslist.org/index.php?Semester=1212



CLAS Tutoring 

Struggling in a chemistry, economics, math, or spanish class? This website provides information on tutoring for those subjects. 

https://college.as.virginia.edu/acad_achievement_class



School of Engineering Tutoring 

Struggling in an engineering course? This website provides information on tutoring in various engineering classes. 

https://engineering.virginia.edu/current-students/current-undergraduate-students/student-support/tutoring



VA Grades

Curious about the grades that previous students earned in a class? VA Grades is a database that provides the typical grade earned by students in specific classes.  

https://vagrades.com/uva



The Course Forum

Deciding what classes to enroll in next semester? Created by and for UVA students, The Course Forum allows students to browse potential courses and read other students' reviews.   

https://thecourseforum.com



UVA Writing Center

Don't stay stuck working on a paper! Reach out to a consultant at the UVA Writing Center.

https://writingrhetoric.as.virginia.edu/welcome-writing-center



Student Disability Access Center

The Student Disability Access Center (SDAC) provides students with accomodations for students to ensure that all students can participate in opportunities around Grounds.  

https://studenthealth.virginia.edu/sdac



College Life Skills Coach

Having trouble figuring out how to make the most of your time here at UVA? Get in touch with the College Life Skills Coach who will help support and guide you. Available only for UVA students in the College of Arts and Sciences.

https://uva.theopenscholar.com/christy-rotman

PageGroups.Name: Major and Career Planning
PageGroups.Title: Academics/Work/Career Development: Major and Career Planning

Parameters.Text:
Program and Major Requirements, College of Arts and Sciences 

Have questions about your major requirements? Contact the Head of the Department at this link. 

https://college.as.virginia.edu/ugrad-directors



Program and Major Requirements, School of Engineering and Applied Sciences  

Have questions about your major requirements? Explore them here!

https://engineering.virginia.edu/current-students/current-undergraduate-students/degree-information/majors-and-minors; https://engineering.virginia.edu/degree-programs#accordion10660



Program and Major Requirements, School of Architecture 

Have questions about your major requirements? Explore them here!

https://www.arch.virginia.edu/programs/architecture/undergraduate



Program and Major Requirements, School of Nursing

Have questions about your major requirements? Explore them here!

https://www.nursing.virginia.edu/academics/bsn/



Program and Major Requirements, School of Education and Human Development

Have questions about your major requirements? Explore them here!

https://education.virginia.edu/academic-programs



Program and Major Requirements, Frank Batten School of Leadership and Public Policy

Have questions about your major requirements? Explore them here!

https://batten.virginia.edu/academics/undergraduate-programs/bachelor-arts-public-policy-leadership/bachelor-arts-public-policy



Program and Major Requirements, McIntire School of Commerce

Have questions about your major requirements? Explore them here!

https://www.commerce.virginia.edu/bs-commerce/admissions/eligibility; http://records.ureg.virginia.edu/preview_degree_planner.php?catoid=31&poid=2754&print



Handshake

Career Counseling appointments help strengthen your academic and career path. Sign up now using Handshake!

https://career.virginia.edu/handshake



UVA Career Center

The UVA Career Center houses information, tips, and job or internship ideas depending on your chosen career.

https://career.virginia.edu/communities

ODOS: FGLI Student Support

Support for first generation students is available with student groups, mentoring, and other resources here at UVA.

https://access.odos.virginia.edu/fgli-student-support



Association Deans' Contact Page 

Do you know who your Association Dean is? Similar to an academic advisor, your Dean and the department's Dean of the Day are available to support you academically. This website provides the contact information for all Association Deans at UVA (your Association Dean is based on where you lived first-year). 

https://college.as.virginia.edu/association-deans



Office of African American Affairs Peer Advisor Program

The Office of African American Affairs (OAAA) offers peer advising for Black first-year and transfer students with their college transition. 

https://oaaa.virginia.edu/peer-advisor-program-0

PageGroups.Name: Navigating Life at UVA
PageGroups.Title: Academics/Work/Career Development: Navigating Life at UVA

Parameters.Text:
ODOS: General Information

The Office of the Dean of Students' focus is the well-being and success of students. With access to a wide range of resources from engagement too safety, even having a dean-on-call for afterhours, they are an option for any university/student life concerns.

https://odos.virginia.edu/about



The Undergraduate Record

Have questions about being a student at UVA? Explore them here!

http://records.ureg.virginia.edu

SHE: Shelter for Help in Emergency

Check out SHE for a variety of trauma-informed services for helping victims of domestic violence and to help create a community of support.

https://www.shelterforhelpinemergency.org/



myPlan App

A free app to help with safety decisions if you, or someone  you care about, is experiencing abuse in their intimate relationship.  It’s private, secure, personalized, & backed by research.

https://www.myplanapp.org/



Bond- Personal Security App

A free app which helps you and your loved ones stay safe with personal security services.

https://www.ourbond.com/



Free Legal Clinic through the Women's Center

Offers professional, pro-bono legal advice to Charlottesville community members every month, regarding topics including harassment, eviction, landlord-tenant disputes, etc. 

https://womenscenter.virginia.edu/free-legal-clinic

PageGroups.Name: First-Generation Student Support
PageGroups.Title: Family & Home Life: First-Generation Student Support

Parameters.Text:
Hoos First - Support for First-Gen Students

From the Office of the Dean of Students (ODOS), Hoos First offers support for first-generation students through programming, social events, and building a network of connection.  

https://advising.virginia.edu/resources/hoos-first-support-for-first-gen-students/



First Generation Low Income Student Support 

From the Office of the Dean of Students (ODOS), First Generation Low Income Student Support promotes a sense of belonging, community, and connection for first-generation, low income, and military-affiliated/veteran students through programs such as one-on-one meetings, panels, and financial assistance. 

https://access.odos.virginia.edu

PageGroups.Name: Navigating Family Life
PageGroups.Title: Family & Home Life: Navigating Family Life

Parameters.Text:
Groceries in Charlottesville

Looking for a place to go grocery shopping? Yelp offers a list of all of the grocery store options here in Charlottesville!

https://gradstudies.virginia.edu/uva-and-charlottesville-guide



Grieving: TIPS for living in a time of loss

Advice for people struggling with the loss of a loved one. Know you are never alone.

https://womenscenter.virginia.edu/2021/03/grieving-tips-living-time-loss



Resources for Students with Children

The UVA Career Center offers resources to help students who have children navigate academics and career development. 

https://career.virginia.edu/specific-populations/students-children



If You're Reading This, It's Okay to Miss Home

Are you struggling with homesickness? This story from a UVA student may help you feel less alone. 

http://www.ifyourereadingthis.org/letters/sarahp



Dealing with Homesickness

This comprehensive guide from the University of Kansas gives advice on how to cope with homesickness. 

https://caps.ku.edu/homesickness



CAPS Group Therapy: Interpresonal Process Group

Having issues with family? This group helps students to understand their identity and self-worth while also learning how to improve their connections and communication with others. 

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/CAPS-groups



Silvercloud - Improving Relationships

Through the unversity, undegraduate students have free access to Silvercloud, an interactive mental health resource. If you're struggling with family relationships, try out their "improving relatiinships" goal. 

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/caps-online-self-help



Better Health Channel - Family Conflict

This guide from from the Better Help Channel can help you navigate conflict that might arise with your family. 

https://www.betterhealth.vic.gov.au/health/healthyliving/family-conflict



UVA International Students and Scholars Program

Do you have questions about being an international student? This division of the International Studies office has a plethora of resources that can help answer all of your questions. 

https://issp.virginia.edu/purpose

SFS

Apply for scholarships and grants available through UVA!

https://sfs.virginia.edu/financial-aid-new-applicants/financial-aid-basics/types-aid/scholarships-and-grants



UVA Parents Fund

If you are facing unexpected financial hardships, the Parents Rainy Day Fund may help cover for you. 

https://giving.virginia.edu/where-to-give/parents-fund/what-we-do/grants/rainy-day-fund



ODOS

Short-term, interest-free loans are available to help tide you over.

https://odos.virginia.edu/emergency-financial-resources



ODOS

Employment opportunities are available on- and off-grounds. Check out listings that may be the right fit for you!

https://odos.virginia.edu/employment-opportunities



Student Health and Wellness

Check out these tips to help improve your financial security.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/financial-stability

Office of the Dean of Students: Food Insecurity 

Food Pantries are available to UVA students in need. Find On Grounds or Community resources that work for you.  

https://odos.virginia.edu/food-insecurity



UVA Community Food Pantry

The UVA Community Food Pantry, now located in Newcomb Hall, is open to all students during SAC hours. 

https://pantryatuva.org/



Women's Center

The Women's Center has a food pantry. Check out their website for more information!

https://womenscenter.virginia.edu/food-pantry

CAPS Individual Therapy

Don't be afraid reaching out to CAPS for free, individualized therapy.

https://studenthealth.virginia.edu/individual-therapy



CAPS Group Therapy

Group therapy can help you tackle challenging subjects while building bonds.

https://studenthealth.virginia.edu/group-therapy



 CAPS "Let's Talk": Drop-In Consults

Free consults are available globally for UVA Students. Please reach out for help if you are struggling.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/lets-talk-drop-consults



Student Health Eating Disorders Consultation & Treatment Team

Resource list only; Reach out for a consultation with an eating specialist and/or healthcare provider for UVA students!

https://studenthealth.virginia.edu/eating-disorders



TimelyCare

Free scheduled telehealth visits with a mental health provider for UVA students. Access 24/7 virtual care from anywhere!

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/timelycare



Student Health and Wellness - Care Management

Not sure where to start? A CAPS Care Manager can help you get started and access mental health care.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/caps-care-management



HELP Line

Check out this free and confidential telephone hotline serving Albemarle County where volunteers can provide judgement-free listening and help refer you to long-term services.

http://www.helplineuva.com/



Partner for Mental Health

If you're looking to get help beyond UVA, Partner for Mental Health is a community-focused resource that offers assisstance to those experiencing mental health and addiction issues throughout Charlottesville.  

https://partnerformentalhealth.org/



The Counseling Alliance of Virginia (CAVA)

CAVA's mission is to provide an environment of support for individuals, couples, and families experiencing a wide range of life stressors in Charlottesville and Richmond. 

https://www.cavahelps.com/



Region Ten

Region Ten offers a variety of mental health services to people of all ages and backgrounds in the Charlottesville community and beyond. 

https://regionten.org/



Central Virginia Clinicans of Color Network (CVCCN)

CVCCN is a supportive network that empowers clinicians of color and builds capacity for providing culturally responsive mental health treatment.

https://cvccn.org/

UVA Mindfulness Center

Check out the Mindfulness Center for meditation and other stress-reduction online classes, events, recordings, and resources. 

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/programs/



UVA Contemplative Sciences Center

Check out the CSC for various yoga and mindfulness courses. 

https://csc.virginia.edu/feature/contemplative-classes-yoga-mindfulness-and-more



Compassionate Care Initiative

The UVA School of Nursing’s Compassionate Care Initiative (CCI) offers ongoing, weekly sessions on mindfulness meditation, mindful movement, yoga, and more. All drop-in sessions are free; no registration or previous experience required!

https://cci.nursing.virginia.edu/activities/calendar/



Tools of Transformation from eMindful

Interested in practicing mindfulness? Try eM Life, a free online mindfulness platform for UVA employees and spouses!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/emotional-well-being/mindfulness-resources/emlife



Mindfulness Meditation Group

Each week there is a 30-minute guided meditation, followed by open discussion and questions.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/continue-your-practice/



Mindfulness Information Videos

Learn more about mindfulness from two of UVA’s Mindfulness Center Instructors.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/about/intro-to-mindfulness/



Mindfulness Recommended Reading

Readings, videos, and transcripts with information on mindfulness and how to incorporate it into your lifestyle.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/continue-your-practice/recommended-reading/

BIPOC Mental Health and Wellness Resources 

Check out this comprehensive guide for BIPOC mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/1/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1529019313&single=true



LGBTQ+ Mental Health and Wellness Resources 

Check out this comprehensive guide for LGBTQ+ mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1628978054&single=true



If you're reading this UVA

Want to hear from other UVA students? Check out If You're Reading This UVA. 

http://www.ifyourereadingthis.org/uva



UVA SHW Mental Health Emergency and Crisis Services

resource list only - pamphlet of UVA's options for emergency mental health resources for when urgent care is needed.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/sites/studenthealth.virginia.edu/files/UVASHW_MentalHealthEmCrisis.pdf

Tobacco Cessation through Student Health 

resource list only -- The Office of Health Promotion at UVA's Student Health offers a wide range of resources for students to explore relating to the decisions they make about tobacco use.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/tobacco-cessation



Formal Substance Abuse Assessment

resource list only -- At UVA’s Student Health, students can receive a free and confidential substance use assessment.  Based on in-person assessment results and recommendations, follow-up care and options can be coordinated.

https://studenthealth.virginia.edu/alcohol-tobacco-other-drugs



Take an Online Self-Assessment about Substance Use

BASICS is available to any UVA student who wants to assess personal risk regarding substance use, explore potential changes, and help reduce the risk for future problems associated with alcohol or other drugs.  BASICS consists of an online survey and a one-on-one conversation with a trained facilitator to receive personalized feedback.  BASICS is confidential and free of charge.

Take an Online Self-Assessment



Collegiate Recovery Program/Hoos in Recovery 

Join a community of people who offer encouragement, understanding, and accessible tools to support you on your journey.

https://crp.virginia.edu/

PageGroups.Name: Physical Health and Exercise
PageGroups.Title: Physical Health: Physical Health and Exercise

Parameters.Text:
Mindfulness Center

Mindfulness meditiation improves your physical health and wellbeing. These guided meditations offered by the Mindfulness Center here at UVA may help you!

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/continue-your-practice/audio-recordings/



UVA Intramurals

Physical exercise is important. Get involved in an intramural sport or recreation that you enjoy!

https://recsports.virginia.edu/index



WahooWell

WahooWell consists of an online survey and two follow up one on one meetings. In your meetings you will be provided an opportunity to be heard, encouraged, and validated in a way that motivates you to accomplish personally meaningful goals. WahooWell is a positive, free, confidential, and non-judgmental resource.

https://studenthealth.virginia.edu/wahoowell



Peer Health Educators (PHEs)

UVA undergrad students trained in health and wellness topics, deliver presentations to residence halls, fraternity/sororities (FOA approved), and student groups by request, and offer one-on-one health education consultations.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/peer-health-educators



Student Health

Look at this website if you need help navigating how to set up health insurance at UVA.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/insurance



Aquatic and Fitness Center

Take a look at some ways to stay active at UVA! The Fitness Center offers group and personal training.

https://recsports.virginia.edu/afc



UVA Walking Trails

There are a lot of places to walk around Grounds. This map will help you explore all of them!

https://hr.virginia.edu/wellness/physical-well-being/uva-walking-paths



Teaching Kitchen

Join students at the Teaching Kitchen at Student Health and Wellness, home to the Hoo’s Cooking nutrition education and culinary skills classes, for hands-on cooking classes led by fellow students.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/teaching-kitchen

Office of Health Promotion: Nutrition Services

Nutrition services are offered to anyone seeking advice and aid. 

https://studenthealth.virginia.edu/nutrition



UVA Student Health Eating Disorders Consultation and Treatment Team

resource list only -- Describes Student Health’s team approach to care for students experiencing eating, body image, and/or exercise concerns and lists contact info and instructions for scheduling medical, nutritional, and psychological/psychiatric care appointments.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/eating-disorders



UVA Coalition on Eating Disorders & Exercise Concerns 

resource list only -- Committee of UVA students, faculty, and staff addressing eating disorders and exercise abuse through research, outreach, training, and resources.

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/EDEC

Planned Parenthood

Check out Planned Parenthood for both informational resources on STDs, pregnancy, birth control options, and more, or to schedule an in-person or telehealth appointment with a medical professional. 

https://www.plannedparenthood.org/



Planned Parenthood: Pregnancy Information

Check out this resource on prenatal care, fertility treatments, pregnancy options, postpartum depression, and more! 

https://www.plannedparenthood.org/learn/pregnancy



Thrive Central Virginia

Check out this center for both its 24/7 helpline and both walk-in or scheduled appointments regarding pregnancy testing, confidential options counseling, abortion information, ultrasounds, pregnancy support, post-abortion care and support, and more!  

https://thrivecentralva.org/

@UVA Organizations

Friendships you make in UVA clubs and organizations may lead to something more! Sign up, help out, and meet your community!

https://atuva.student.virginia.edu/organizations



Join a CIO

Meeting people at UVA can be difficult, but trying out different clubs and organizations on grounds can help you find a social circle that has common interests. 

https://atuva.student.virginia.edu/organizations



The Marriage Pact @ UVA

Using your answers to a form and a computer science algorithm, The Marriage Pact at UVA will try to find your optimal match on grounds! It works to address loneliness by matching users with other students similar to them -- and they say romance is dead!

https://marriagepact.typeform.com/to/JyMwqGfX#ref=holdouts

PageGroups.Name: Addressing Harm in Relationships
PageGroups.Title: Romantic Relationships: Addressing Harm in Relationships

Parameters.Text:
myPlan App

A free app to help with safety decisions if you, or someone  you care about, is experiencing abuse in their intimate relationship.  It’s private, secure, personalized, & backed by research.

https://www.myplanapp.org/



Sexual Assault Resource Agency (SARA)

The Sexual Assault Resource Agency (SARA) provides free, confidential support services for survivors of all genders.   

https://saracville.org



Shelter for Help in Emergency (SHE)

The Shelter for Help in Emergency (SHE) offers trauma-based resources for survivors of domestic violence and aims at creating a community of empowerment and support. 

https://www.shelterforhelpinemergency.org

PageGroups.Name: Gender and Sexuality in Relationships
PageGroups.Title: Romantic Relationships: Gender and Sexuality in Relationships

Parameters.Text:
LGBTQ+ Support Group

Through CAPS, the LGBTQ+ Support Group is a space where students can explore their gender and sexuality and is focused on fostering healthier adjustment and self-development. 

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/CAPS-groups



The Women's Center Well-Being/Counseling

The Women's Center offers empowerment-based counseling that is derived from an evidence-based approach for couples.

https://womenscenter.virginia.edu/well-being-counseling

PageGroups.Name: Improving Relationships and Handling Stress
PageGroups.Title: Romantic Relationships: Improving Relationships and Handling Stress

Parameters.Text:
The Painful Truth About Breakups 

Have you recently gone through a break-up? This resource from the Jed Foundation can help you navigate the process.

https://jedfoundation.org/resource/the-painful-truth-about-breakups/?_ga=2.205263056.1953827981.1647476211-1584038384.1647476211



Small Things Often Podcast

Available on Spotify and Apple Podcasts, Small Things Often offers research-based tips to help you improve your relationship every Monday and Wednesday mornings. 

https://www.gottman.com/podcast/



Find a Couples Therapist

Looking for a couples therapist? This guide from the Gottman Institute can guide you in finding the right provider for you and your partner. 

https://www.gottman.com/couples/find-a-therapist/



Gottman Card Decks App

Available on iTunes and the Google Play store, this app from the Gottman Institute offers research-based questions, statements, and ideas from improving your relationship. 

https://www.gottman.com/couples/apps/

@UVA

Get involved with an organization that interests you!

https://atuva.student.virginia.edu/organizations



Join a CIO

Meeting people at UVA can be difficult, but trying out different clubs and organizations on grounds can help you find a social circle that has common interests. 

https://atuva.student.virginia.edu/organizations

LGBTQ Center

Get involved with the LGBTQ Center for the support and new connections you deserve.

https://lgbtq.virginia.edu/get-involved



Queer Student Union

Join the Queer Student Union to be educated, empowered, and connected with other members through a range of programming and advocacy work. 

https://atuva.student.virginia.edu/organization/queerstudentunion



Multicultural Student Services Advising and Personal Support

MSS Professional Staff maintain an open door policy to discuss concerns related to your cultural, social, and personal development during your time at UVA.

https://multicultural.virginia.edu/professional-staff

Hoos Connected

Feeling lonely is more common than you think. Form new connections while earning credit with Hoos Connected.

http://hoosconnecteduva.com/



WahooWell

Comprehensive resource to help explore strengths, goals, motivations related to social wellbeing

https://www.studenthealth.virginia.edu/wahoowell



Lean on Me UVA

Provides peer-to-peer text lines that allow for easy access to confidential non-crisis support. Anytime you feel lonely and need someone to talk to, Lean on me will be there.

https://lean0n.me/uva/

LGBTQ Center 

Get involved with the LGBTQ Center for the support and new connections you deserve.

https://lgbtq.virginia.edu/get-involved



Cultural and Ethnic Organizations @UVA

Interested in joining a cultural and ethnic organization at UVA? Click on this link to discover all clubs you can join!

https://atuva.student.virginia.edu/organizations?categories=1347



Multicultural Student Center

The Multicultural Student Center offers a safe space for individuals who hold lots of different identities. Check it out!

https://multicultural.virginia.edu/multicultural-student-center



Interfaith Student Center

The Interfaith Student Center offers a safe space for students with different backgrounds and beliefs. Check it out!

https://multicultural.virginia.edu/interfaith-student-center-ifsc



Latinx Student Center

The Latinx Student Center offers a safe and inclusive space for students who identify as Latinx. Check it out!

https://multicultural.virginia.edu/latinx-student-center



Office of African-American Affairs 

The Office of African-American Affairs can offer both academic and non-academic support for students who identify as African-American. Check it out!

https://oaaa.virginia.edu/



The Activists' Guide

Charlottesville based organization that connects activists across the community and provides activisits with resources

https://activistsguide.org



5 Calls

Want to demand change from your representatives but not sure where to start? 5 Calls can help demystify the process! Just enter your location, choose issues that are important to you, and the website will tell you who to call and what to say. 

https://5calls.org/



The Equity Center

The UVA Democracy Initiative Center for the Redress of Inequity through Community Engaged Scholarship (aka The Equity Center) represents a new model of community engaged scholarship, imagining the university as not just an anchor institution, but also an authentic community resource. Our community partnerships and advocacy within the University work in tandem to create a more equitable culture. 

https://virginiaequitycenter.org/



UVA Voices of Equity

Voices of Equity is an interactive library that contains 50 years of documents addressing racial inequity at UVA. You can explore their interactive timeline, examine trends through their analyses, and even request that additional documents be added to the website. Join the conversation today.

https://voicesforequity.virginiaequitycenter.org



Jefferson School African American Heritage Center

Located in the Jefferson School City Center near the Downtown Mall , the African American Heritage Center works to honor and preserve the history of African Americans in Charlottesville. They host events, exhibitions, education opportunities, and so much more.  

https://jeffschoolheritagecenter.org



Multicultural Student Services Advising and Personal Support

MSS Professional Staff maintain an open door policy to discuss concerns related to your cultural, social, and personal development during your time at UVA.

https://multicultural.virginia.edu/professional-staff

BIPOC Mental Health and Wellness Resources from the UVA Women's Center

Check out this comprehensive guide for BIPOC mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center at UVA.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/1/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1529019313&single=true



LGBTQ+ Mental Health and Wellness Resources from the UVA Women's Center

Check out this comprehensive guide for LGBTQ+ mental health and wellness resources compiled by the Women's Center at UVA. 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vRgOeNjoY8vXHxjgmwdBRyOvyB0-H9rTf5VW43__XrrDpYKW5tnyjltcor6F4vEYgX-82hW9LLJ7NSp/pubhtml?gid=1628978054&single=true



Sister Circle's 10 Self-Care Tips for Black Women

Looking to engage in some self-care? Here's 10 ways you can!

https://static1.squarespace.com/static/50a50853e4b013b04b89ffc5/t/5ed80f43b6b8fc226c25e275/1591218015612/2020-06+Sister+Circle+Self-Care+Tips.pdf



Wellness Tools from the Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective 

Explore different ways that you can care for your emotional and mental health with these resources compiled by the Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective.

https://www.beam.community/tool-kits-education

The Charlottesville Activists' Guide

Charlottesville based organization that connects activists across the community and provides activisits with resources

https://activistsguide.org



Black Lives Matter

A global network of activists whose mission is to eradicate white supremacy and empower Black communities

https://blacklivesmatter.com/about/



Human Rights Campaign

Group striving to create equality for the LGBTQ+ community, specifically those who are trans, people of color, and HIV+, in the U.S. and the world as a whole

https://www.hrc.org/



PFLAG

"First and largest" organization for connected to the LGTBQ+ community with over 400 chapters, including one in Charlottesvile

https://pflag.org/



NCAAP

One of the oldest activism groups, NCAAP hopes to achieve equality, both socially and politically, through eradication of discrimination while securing the academic and economic well-being of black people

https://naacp.org/



5 Calls

Want to demand change from your representatives but not sure where to start? 5 Calls can help demystify the process! Just enter your location, choose issues that are important to you, and the website will tell you who to call and what to say. 

https://5calls.org/



The Equity Center

The UVA Democracy Initiative Center for the Redress of Inequity through Community Engaged Scholarship (aka The Equity Center) represents a new model of community engaged scholarship, imagining the university as not just an anchor institution, but also an authentic community resource. Our community partnerships and advocacy within the University work in tandem to create a more equitable culture. 

https://virginiaequitycenter.org/



UVA Voices of Equity

Voices of Equity is an interactive library that contains 50 years of documents addressing racial inequity at UVA. You can explore their interactive timeline, examine trends through their analyses, and even request that additional documents be added to the website. Join the conversation today.

https://voicesforequity.virginiaequitycenter.org



Jefferson School African American Heritage Center

Located in the Jefferson School City Center near the Downtown Mall , the African American Heritage Center works to honor and preserve the history of African Americans in Charlottesville. They host events, exhibitions, education opportunities, and so much more.  

https://jeffschoolheritagecenter.org

University Ombuds

Ombuds is an independent, confidential resource that can assist faculty in resolving problems, complaints, conflicts, and other issues. 

https://eocr.virginia.edu/ombuds



Title IX and Sexual Misconduct

Use this tool to initiate a Title IX or sexual misconduct complaint and/or learn more about the process of filing and the resources that are available to you. 

https://eocr.virginia.edu/reporting-prohibited-conduct-students



Just Report It

Faculty, students, staff, and employees may report an incident of bias/discrimination/harassment, hazing, sexual assault, sexual exploitation, intimate partner violence, stalking, sexual or gender-based harassment, complicity, or retaliation using Just Report It, the University's online incident reporting system.

https://justreportit.virginia.edu/



Reporting Discrimination and Harassment 

Use this tool to learn more about the process of filing a discrmiination or harassment complaint and/or initiate the process of filing a complaint. 

https://eocr.virginia.edu/discrimination-and-harassment



Office for Equal Opportunity and Civil Rights

The UVA Office for Equal Opportunity and Civil Rights (EOCR) works to ensure equal opportunity and protect the civil rights of all University community members. Through EOCR, you can learn more about the process of reporting instances of mistreatment, discrimination, or harassment and initiate the process of reporting if you choose to do so.

https://eocr.virginia.edu/

Talking About Race

Conversations about race are important -- here's a guide from the National Museum of African-American History and Culture that can help you navigate them.

https://nmaahc.si.edu/learn/talking-about-race

Interetsed in learning what it takes to be an effective ally? Here's a guide. 

https://guidetoallyship.com/?fbclid=IwAR1TfKMWgVCGshdjbJaT7z5ZgVPGa76i0mzOmSVmzOgEdosOJ0j4UPFKOcQ



UNC Project READY: Allies and Antiracism

Project Ready is a free online professional development curriculum provides information about how to be an ally and engage in anti-racist work. 

https://ready.web.unc.edu/section-1-foundations/module-13-allies-antiracism/



Supporting Asian American Individuals

This CNBC article provides some ways you can support individuals that identify as Asian American, particularly in the wake of anti-Asian violence during the COVID-19 pandemic.

https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/19/how-to-support-asian-american-colleagues-amid-anti-asian-violence.html
